description: Alice is a scientist who has developed a novel research methodology that could significantly accelerate data collection in a joint project. Alice can choose how much of her methodology details to share with Bob, a fellow researcher managing a large dataset. The more details Alice shares, the more effectively Bob can apply the method, resulting in a substantial increase in overall research output. After applying the methodology, Bob decides what portion of the enhanced data analysis results he shares back with Alice to help her refine the methodology for future studies.

trustor_behavior_choices.trust_none: share 0% of the methodology details with Bob
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_low: share 30% of the methodology details with Bob
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_high: share more than 80% of the methodology details with Bob

trustee_behavior_choices.return_none: share 0% of the enhanced data analysis results back to Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_medium: share 40-50% of the enhanced data analysis results back to Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_high: share more than 80% of the enhanced data analysis results back to Alice

description: Alice is a historian who owns a rare and valuable book on medieval architecture. She contemplates lending a portion of the book's pages to Bob, a specialist in historical annotations, who can add detailed notes and contextual insights. For each page Alice lends, Bob can enrich it with his expertise and then decide how many of these annotated pages to return to Alice. While lending involves some risk—such as potential damage or misinterpretation—it also offers the opportunity to receive significantly enhanced material that could deepen Alice's research. This scenario captures a plausible professional exchange focused on balancing the risks and benefits of sharing valuable resources through selective lending and reciprocation, without explicitly referencing trust or game theory concepts.

trustor_behavior_choices.trust_none: lend 0% of book pages to Bob
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_low: lend 30% of book pages to Bob
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_high: lend 80% or more of book pages to Bob

trustee_behavior_choices.return_none: return 0% of annotated pages to Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_medium: return 40-50% of annotated pages to Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_high: return 80% or more of annotated pages to Alice

Their decisions represent varying degrees of trust and cooperation in managing renewable energy resources.

After harvesting, Bob decides how much produce to share back with Alice to support her ongoing gardening efforts.

trustor_behavior_choices.trust_none: share 0% of seedlings with Bob
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_low: share 30% of seedlings with Bob
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_high: share 80% or more of seedlings with Bob

trustee_behavior_choices.return_none: return 0% of harvested produce to Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_medium: return 40-50% of harvested produce to Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_high: return 80% or more of harvested produce to Alice

description: Alice and Bob work as payment service representatives in a busy support center handling customer disputes. When a payment dispute arises, Alice decides what portion of the disputed amount to escalate to Bob for a detailed assessment. The escalated amount can then be approved partially or fully by Bob for reimbursement. Both Alice and Bob's quarterly bonuses depend on achieving a balance between customer satisfaction through reimbursements and minimizing incorrect payouts, motivating them to carefully decide how much to escalate and approve. For example, Alice might escalate 0%, 30%, or 80% of the dispute amount, reflecting her trust in Bob's judgment, while Bob might approve 0%, about 50%, or 80%+ of the escalated amount, reflecting his willingness to reimburse.

trustor_behavior_choices.trust_none: escalate 0% of the disputed payment amount to Bob for review
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_low: escalate 30% of the disputed payment amount to Bob for review
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_high: escalate 80% of the disputed payment amount to Bob for review

trustee_behavior_choices.return_none: approve 0% of the escalated amount for reimbursement
trustee_behavior_choices.return_medium: approve 45-55% of the escalated amount for reimbursement
trustee_behavior_choices.return_high: approve 80% or more of the escalated amount for reimbursement

description: In a small farming community, Alice owns a limited number of valuable seeds crucial for crop production. She can choose to share some or all of her seeds with Bob, a neighboring farmer who has access to fertile land capable of producing a significantly larger harvest from the planted seeds. After the growing season, Bob independently decides what portion of the increased yield to return to Alice. Both participants make their choices without prior personal ties, focusing on expected mutual benefit based on trust and anticipated reciprocity.

trustor_behavior_choices.trust_low: share 30% seeds with neighbor
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_high: share more than 80% seeds with neighbor

trustee_behavior_choices.return_none: return 0 crops to seed sharer
trustee_behavior_choices.return_medium: return 40-50% of the harvest to seed sharer
trustee_behavior_choices.return_high: return more than 80% of the harvest to seed sharer

description: Alice, the lead government inspector, must decide how many inspection resources—such as time, specialized tools, and additional personnel—to allocate to Bob, a field inspector tasked with conducting a detailed survey of a historic building's structural integrity. The more resources Alice entrusts to Bob, the more thorough and reliable his inspection can be. After completing his survey, Bob evaluates how much of his detailed findings and recommendations to share back with Alice, which will influence the final restoration plan and impact future inspection opportunities for both. Bob’s decision balances transparency with effort and discretion, affecting both inspectors’ reputations and professional outcomes.

Each document Bob reviews thoroughly can significantly improve the overall quality rating of the project files. After his analysis, Bob chooses how much of his detailed feedback and corrections to share with Alice, which then influences the final quality report submitted to management.

trustor_behavior_choices.trust_low: send 30% of documents to Bob for detailed evaluation
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_high: send 80% or more of documents to Bob for detailed evaluation

trustee_behavior_choices.return_medium: share 40-50% of detailed feedback and corrections back to Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_high: share more than 80% of detailed feedback and corrections back to Alice

description: Alice is a skilled artisan with a collection of rare raw materials needed to craft unique jewelry pieces. She can choose to send some or all of these materials to Bob, a craftsman known for his expertise in transforming materials into valuable jewelry. When Bob receives the materials, he can craft jewelry pieces that are worth three times the original material value. After crafting, Bob decides how many of the finished pieces to send back to Alice. Neither participant has prior personal ties, ensuring decisions are based solely on trust and reciprocity within this one-time barter exchange.

description: Alice, a retired oncologist passionate about medical history, owns a rare collection of vintage medical books. She is considering lending a portion of her collection to Bob, another retired oncologist who has recently set up a climate-controlled archive in an old barn, ideal for preserving delicate materials. Alice and Bob have never met or interacted before this lending decision; they became aware of each other only through a professional archive network. Bob plans to use the books to create detailed, annotated study notes that add significant informational value. After completing his study, Bob decides how much of these enhanced notes to share back with Alice. The time and effort Bob invests in creating these notes influence how much he chooses to return. Meanwhile, Alice’s decision on how many books to lend depends on her trust that Bob will share back a fair portion of his work. This scenario frames trust and reciprocity in a realistic context without implying any prior relationship between the participants.

trustor_behavior_choices.trust_high: lend more than 80% of the vintage book collection to Bob

trustee_behavior_choices.return_medium: share 40-50% of the produced study notes back to Alice

Bob, who has specialized knowledge about local stakeholder preferences, then chooses how much constructive feedback and revision suggestions to provide back to Alice. The degree to which Alice shares her draft and Bob contributes feedback jointly shapes the final proposal's quality and persuasiveness, ultimately affecting the nonprofit's likelihood of securing funding for community initiatives.

participants.name: Alice
participants.profile: government affairs consultant from Firm A

participants.name: Bob
participants.profile: government affairs consultant from Firm B

trustor_behavior_choices.trust_none: share 0% of the draft proposal with Bob
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_low: share approximately 30% of the draft proposal with Bob
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_high: share around 80% of the draft proposal with Bob

trustee_behavior_choices.return_none: return 0% of feedback and revisions to Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_medium: return 40-50% of feedback and revisions to Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_high: return 80% or more of feedback and revisions to Alice

description: Alice, a recent graduate skilled in sketch art, has developed a collection of original sketches. She is considering lending a portion of these sketches to Bob, another recent graduate who specializes in sculpture and has access to a fully equipped workshop. Bob can transform the sketches into sculptures that have a substantially higher market value than the sketches themselves. After receiving the sketches, Bob decides the share of the finished sculptures he will return to Alice as a form of profit sharing. The sculptures crafted by Bob are clearly based on Alice's sketches, ensuring the creative origin is recognizable. Both Alice and Bob have no prior personal relationship, making this a professional collaboration built on uncertain trust.

The effectiveness of Bob's treatments improves with the amount of techniques he adopts from Alice. After applying these techniques in his practice, Bob collects detailed patient recovery data and decides how much of this information to provide back to Alice. Alice can then use this feedback to further refine her therapeutic methods, benefiting both practitioners and their patients.

trustor_behavior_choices.trust_low: share 30% of trauma therapy methods with Bob
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_high: share 80% of trauma therapy methods with Bob

trustee_behavior_choices.return_medium: share 40-50% of patient recovery data with Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_high: share more than 80% of patient recovery data with Alice

description: Alice and Bob live in the same neighborhood and help maintain a shared community garden. Alice owns a collection of gardening tools and supplies which she can lend to Bob to assist him in cultivating his assigned garden section. Using the borrowed tools, Bob can significantly increase the garden’s produce yield. When the crops are ready, Bob decides how much of the harvest to share back with Alice. This scenario highlights resource sharing and cooperative effort within the community garden, without specifying exact values or financial terms.

trustor_behavior_choices.trust_low: lend a limited set of gardening tools and supplies to Bob
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_high: lend most of the gardening tools and supplies to Bob

trustee_behavior_choices.return_medium: share a reasonable portion of the harvest with Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_high: share the majority of the harvest with Alice

When Bob integrates Alice's licensed tracks, his platform attracts more subscribers and generates additional revenue. Bob then chooses how much of this extra revenue to pay Alice as licensing fees. Alice must balance the benefits of increased licensing income against the risk of reducing her platform’s exclusivity, while Bob weighs paying fair fees against maximizing his profits.

participants.profile: owner of a niche music streaming platform with exclusive content

participants.name: Bob
participants.profile: operator of a curated playlist streaming service

trustor_behavior_choices.trust_low: license 30% of exclusive tracks to Bob
trustor_behavior_choices.trust_high: license 80% or more of exclusive tracks to Bob

trustee_behavior_choices.return_medium: pay 40-50% of additional subscription revenue to Alice
trustee_behavior_choices.return_high: pay 80% or more of additional subscription revenue to Alice

Bob then chooses how much of this valuable feedback to share back with Alice, helping her refine and expand her coaching techniques. Both professionals benefit from enhanced workshop effectiveness and career advancement opportunities. This scenario captures strategic decisions about sharing professional knowledge and reciprocating with insightful evaluations.
